content:
• Tuesday, December 1, 2015
  • ASTI

    Ascent posts 34.9% gain after presenting military solar/energy storage solution

    • Having closed yesterday just a penny above a low of $0.10, Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI) rallied today (all the way to $0.15) after presenting its MilPak solar and energy storage platform at an Austin defense energy tech conference.
    • Ascent claims its first-gen MilPak product, the MilPak E, is "designed to withstand the harshest environments and most demanding uses possible." In addition to the military, first responders and disaster relief are mentioned as potential applications. (presentation - .pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • VHC

    VirnetX closes up 18.1%; insider buys continue

    • Beaten-down VirnetX (NYSEMKT:VHC) surged today on volume of 2.29M shares, far above a 3-month daily average of 277K. The IP licensing firm remains down 44% YTD.
    • Yesterday afternoon, director Robert Short disclosed he bought nearly 7K shares via two recent purchases made at $2.70. They followed two 3K-share purchases previously made in November, and raise Short's stake to 63,381. CFO Richard Nance bought 3K shares on Nov. 16.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • TMUS

    T-Mobile adds 11 smaller services to free music streaming offering

    • T-Mobile (TMUS +1.9%) has added 11 more (if smaller) music services to its Music Freedom free-streaming initiative.
    • The carrier had launched that offering -- where it exempts streaming music services from counting against subscribers' data allocations -- last year, and it proved to be a precursor to T-Mobile's "Binge On" promotion treating video as also exempt.
    • Joining Music Freedom today are Aud.io, StreamOn, L.A. station KCRW, and TuneIn Premium as well as genre-based services like SomaFM and Spinrilla.
    • The additions bring the total to 44 streaming music services participating. T-Mobile says its customers now stream more than 196M songs daily, up 311% from the time Music Freedom was launched.
    • Previously: FCC chairman: T-Mobile video initiative 'highly competitive' (Nov. 19 2015)
    • Previously: T-Mobile's video 'binge': Partners, revenue effects, fretting net neutrality (Nov. 11 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM
  • ONDK

    On Deck Capital +27% AH on J.P. Morgan partnership

    • On Deck Capital (NYSE:ONDK) +27.6%Â AH after disclosing it is working with JPMorgan Chase (NYSE:JPM) in a strategic partnership for JPM to use its small business lending platform and its OnDeck Score to serve its small business customers.
    • ONDK says it is in the process of building out its integration with JPM and finalizing definitive agreements regarding the partnership, which it expects to begin operations in 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM
  • GWRE

    Guidewire up 4.6% after FQ1 beat, in-line guidance

    • Guidewire (NYSE:GWRE) has risen to $63.35 after hours after beating FQ1 estimates and reporting 12% Y/Y license revenue growth, a slight improvement from FQ4's 11%. The insurance software firm expects FQ2 revenue of $94.5M-$98.5M and EPS of $0.13-$0.16 vs. a consensus of $95.6M and $0.14, and FY16 (ends July '16) revenue of $406M-$416M and EPS of $0.57-$0.66 vs. a consensus of $411.1M and $0.61.
    • License revenue (drives future maintenance/services revenue) totaled $32.3M. Term license revenue was up 19% excluding year-ago milestone payments for an existing contract. Maintenance revenue rose 12% to $14M; services revenue fell 6% to $35.9M.
    • GAAP operating expenses rose 18% Y/Y to $56.1M - $25.7M was spent on R&D, $19.3M on sales/marketing, and $11.1M on G&A. Guidewire ended FQ1 with $663.6M in cash/investments, and no debt.
    • FQ1 results, PR
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • TRP

    Columbia Pipeline to launch 51M-share offering

    • Columbia Pipeline (CPGX) -1.5%Â AH after announcing a public offering of 51M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 7.65M shares.
    • CPGX says it plans to use the proceeds, together with cash flow from operations and available borrowings under its revolving credit facilities, to fully fund its 2016 capital spending requirements.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: HOLX +18.9%. ASNA +7.9%. GWRE +4.9%. ERIC +4.6%. CNHI +1.6%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: POWL -11.4%. BOBE -5.3%. ALU -4.7%. GFI -4.2%. LGCY -4.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 3 Comments
  • IPHI

    Inphi plans $150M convertible debt offering

    • Inphi (NYSE:IPHI) plans to sell $150M worth of convertible senior notes due 2020. Initial purchasers are expected to have a $22.5M overallotment option.
    • Aside from capped call transactions related to the offering, net proceeds will be used for "general corporate purposes, including financing potential acquisitions and other strategic transactions." Inphi adds it currently "has no commitments" regarding an acquisition or strategic transaction.
    • The telecom and data center analog/mixed-signal chipmaker had $102M in cash/short-term investments at the end of Q3, and no debt. Shares haven't yet moved after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • ACHV

    OncoGenex's late-stage study of custirsen in prostate cancer to continue as planned; separate analysis shows no improvement in OS in men with poor prognoses; shares down 29% after hours

    • Based on a pre-planned interim futility analysis by the independent Data Monitoring Committee, OncoGenex Pharmaceuticals' (OGXI) Phase 3 clinical trial, AFFINITY, evaluating lead product candidate custirsen, in combination with cabazitaxel, in men with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (CRPC) will continue as planned. The data remain blinded with final results expected in H2 2016.
    • The study is designed to assess if treatment with custirsen plus cabazitaxel improves survival in men with CRPC whose disease has progressed following treatment with docetaxel. The primary endpoints are overall survival (OS) in the intent-to-treat population and overall survival in patients with poor prognoses.
    • A separate analysis of the poor prognosis subpopulation failed to show an improvement in OS from treatment with the combination of custirsen and cabazitaxel according to the stringent criteria used. The company pursued this treatment-resistant group with the aim of getting quicker regulatory clearance.
    • According to CEO Scott Cormack, the results from the ITT population alone should be sufficient for regulatory approval.
    • Custirsen blocks the production of the proteinÂ clusterin, which is believed to play a key role in cancer cell survival and treatment resistance.
    • Shares are offÂ 29%Â after hours on robust volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • NWHM

    New Home launches secondary

    • The New Home Company (NYSE:NWHM) is selling about 3.5M shares, with underwriter greenshoe of 525K. If the underwriters exercise their option, the sale would boost the float by nearly 25%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • GWRE

    Guidewire Software beats by $0.04, beats on revenue

    • Guidewire Software (NYSE:GWRE): FQ1 EPS of $0.07 beats by $0.04.
    • Revenue of $82.28M (+3.2% Y/Y) beats by $0.85M.
    • Shares +1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • BOBE

    Comps decelerate for Bob Evans Farms during FQ2

    • Bob Evans Farms (NASDAQ:BOBE) reports same-store sales fell 3.2% in its restaurant segment during FQ2. Comps decelerated to a 4.4% decline in October.
    • BEF Foods operating income rose 176% Y/Y to $17.6M.
    • Full-year EPS guidance of $1.85-$2.00 was reaffirmed by the company.
    • The Bob Evans buyback allowance was upped by $100M.
    • Previously: Bob Evans Farms beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Dec. 1)
    • BOBEÂ -1.0%Â after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • GST

    Gastar Exploration started with Buy rating, $2 target price, at Canaccord

    • Gastar Exploration (GST -1.8%) is lower even after Canaccord initiates coverage with a Buy rating and $2 price target, noting GST is on the verge of becoming an almost pure Mid-Continent play with oily assets in some of the best emerging areas of Oklahoma.
    • The firm says the monetization of GST's Marcellus and Utica Shale assets in Appalachia, some of which are on the market, would help enhance the company's financial position, with proceeds used to delever the balance sheet and/or be reinvested in the Mid-Con assets.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 9 Comments
  • GDP

    Goodrich Petroleum downgraded to Sell at Stifel

    • Goodrich Petroleum (GDP -15.8%) is downgraded to Sell from Hold with a $0.20 price target at Stifel, following a reduction in the firm's Q4 and 2016 oil and gas price forecasts.
    • Stifel thinks oil would need to approach $60/bbl for projects such as GDP's TMS drilling program to be worth the investment; as oil has been plagued by oversupply, the firm says GDP's prospects do not look positive in the near term until there is a reversal in oil prices.
    • Separately, GDP says the NYSE has accepted its plan to maintain its listing, as the company's market cap remains below the required limit.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM | 23 Comments
  • CENX

    South Carolina regulator rejects Century Aluminum power proposal

    • Century Aluminum (CENX +8.7%) is higher after South Carolina power utilityÂ Santee Cooper rejected a request to allow a CENX aluminum plant to buy cheaper power from out of state, a step that raises the likelihood of the plant's closure at the end of the year.
    • According to officials, the CENX facility in Mount Holly, S.C., offered to pay Santee Cooper ~$60M in transmission fees over the next five years so the smelter could buy the cheaper power elsewhere.
    • Santee Cooper maintained that other customers would have to foot the bill if they granted CENX's request.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 5 Comments
  • GLBL

    TerraForm Global pulls out of Brazil power deal worth $3.45B

    • TerraForm Global (GLBL +10.6%) is pulling out of a deal to take control of projects accounting for 2,200 MW of generation capacity due to adverse market conditions in Brazil, Reuters reports, citing companies involved in the deal.
    • GLBL had been negotiating to take control of generation assets from Brazilian renewable energy company Renova Energia in a share swap valued at 13.4B reais ($3.45B), but the deal began to come apart when GLBL parent SunEdison (SUNE +12,5%) decided not to proceed with a contract to buy a 15% stake in Renova.
    • The stake sale was a condition for the larger GLBL deal to go ahead, Renova said in a filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 8 Comments
  • MWE

    MarkWest shareholders approve MPLX tie-up

    • MarkWest Energy (MWE -4.8%) unitholders vote to approve a merger deal with MPLX (MPLX -13.6%), overcoming opposition from two MWE founders; the deal is now expected to be completed by Dec. 4.
    • The agreement will make MWE, the second largest natural gas processor in the U.S., a subsidiary of Marathon Petroleum (MPC +0.9%) pipeline operator MPLX, and create one of the biggest MLPs.
    • The overall value of the cash and stock deal originally was pegged at ~$15B in July but had fallen to ~$10B by mid-November amid plunging energy stock prices, when MPC increased the cash portion of the deal to $6.20/unit for MWE shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 9 Comments
  • NSM

    Nationstar Mortgage slides after Raman exit

    • Nationstar (NSM -2.7%) bulls may have thought they had a unicorn on their hands in Xome Holdings, but those dreams are likely over after the departure of the unit's head, Kal Raman.
    • Following the news, Sterne Agee cuts its price target on the stock to $12 from $15 (current price is $13.24).
    • Previously: Nationstar Mortgage and Kal Raman part ways (Nov. 30)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 2 Comments
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan’s investment grade rating at risk as Moody's lowers outlook

    • Kinder Morgan (KMI -4.4%) slumps to a 52-week low as Moody's changes its credit outlook to negative from stable, warning that a downgrade could follow; if Moody’s reduces its rating from Baa3 to Ba1, KMI officially would be in junk territory.
    • The ratings agency says its negative outlook reflects KMI’s increased business risk profile and additional pressure on its already high leverage that will result from yesterday's announced deal to increase ownership in the "distressed" Natural Gas Pipeline Company of America.
    • NGPL is facing potential default on its pending interest payments, Moody's says, which suggests that KMI will need to provide cash injections that likely will be debt funded initially.
    • SunTrust's Tristan Richardson estimates that NGPL is ~10x levered; the firm maintains its projections and $38 price target for KMI, but expects the call on capital to increase with the transaction.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 73 Comments
  • GBIM

    Traders pile into GlobeImmune on merger rumors

    • Thinly traded nano cap GlobeImmune (OTC:GBIM +40.4%) heads north on a 10x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 350K shares, on rumors of a possible merger, certainly a predictable outcome of its previously announced plan to explore strategic alternatives.
    • Shares are upÂ 127%Â since November 17.
    • Previously: GlobeImmune cuts most of workforce; shares drop 26% (June 10)
    • Previously: GlobeImmune therapeutic vaccine candidate for hepatitis B flunks Phase 2 study; shares off 62% premarket (May 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • TD

    Canadian lenders in the green following earnings

    • The Canadian banking sector is mostly known for being roughed up this year thanks to concerns over a bubbly housing market and the crash in natural resources prices, but it's enjoyed a decent bounce since late August.
    • The move continues today following FQ4 results from Scotiabank and Bank of Montreal. After adjusting for some items, Scotiabank missed estimates, says Barclays' John Aiken, and he also questions the quality of BMO's beat, noting gains tied to an asset sale and recovery from a legal settlement.
    • Bank of Montreal also tossed in a dividend hike and new buyback plan.
    • BMO isÂ higher by 1.5%Â on the session, and BNSÂ by 0.1%. Reporting later this week: TD Bank (TD +1.2%), Royal Bank (RY +1.2%), and CIBC (CM +1.1%).
    • Previously: BMO adds buyback to dividend hike and earnings beat (Dec. 1)
    • Previously: Bank of Nova Scotia beats by C$0.03, misses on revenue (Dec. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: OTC:GIGA +159%. DHRM +112%. CLNT +95%. ERB +39%. VHC +35%. TERP +34%. OTC:GBIM +27%. CADC +24%. BLOX +22%. HFFC +19%.
    • Losers: GBL -46%. RPRX -26%. BBEP -22%. OTC:BONT -21%. ICA -20%. CLRB -17%. MPLX -15%. JOY -14%. NCTY -13%. REXX -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • INVE

    Identiv down 12.5% after disclosing auditor's resignation, disagreements

    • Indetiv (NASDAQ:INVE) has disclosed the resignation of BDO as the company's public accounting firm. Burr Pilger Mayer has been hired to replace BDO, which is now unwilling to be associated with Identiv's 2015 financial statements.
    • While BDO's reports for Identiv's recent financial statements don't contain an adverse opinion or disclaimer of opinion, BDO has advised the board it's "unwilling to be associated with the consolidated financial statements prepared by management for any of the fiscal periods within 2015 and will not complete its reviews of the interim financial information as of or for the periods ended March 31, 2015, June 30, 2015 or September 30, 2015, and additionally will not audit the Company's consolidated financial statements as of and for the year ending December 31, 2015," due to an accounting review disagreement.
    • Specifically, BDO "disagrees with the scope and the remediation" of a special committee investigation (disclosed in May) into accounting issues, and has found two material weaknesses in Identiv's internal control over financial reporting. One relates to entity level controls - BDO asserts "the Company's senior management leadership and operating style and the Board's oversight did not result in an open flow of information and communication and did not support an environment where accountability is valued - and the other involves revenue recognition.
    • Shares are now down 81% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:34 PM | 1 Comment
  • ERB

    ERBA Diagnostics up 30% on cash infusion from German parent

    • Thinly traded nano cap ERBA Diagnostics (ERB +29.7%) is up on an 11x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 111K shares, in response to its announcement that its German parent and majority stockholder, ERBA Diagnostics Mannheim GmbH, intends to infuse $3.5M into the company in the coming weeks. The cash is the final tranche of the previously reported April 2011 Stock Purchase Agreement between the two firms. After the transfer, the Mannheim organization will own ~83.3% of the company's stock (from 81.6%).
    • The new capital will fund the enhancement of manufacturing and additional sales and marketing initiatives.
    • The U.S.-based firm intends to restate its financial statements for 2013 and 2014 as well as the quarters ended March 31, 2015 and June 30, 2015.
    • Previously: ERBA Diagnostics says previous financials can't be relied upon (Nov. 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • MBI

    Puerto Rico makes payment; monolines higher

    • The Government Development Bank for Puerto Rico paid all principal and interest due today on certain of its notes.
    • "Today’s debt service payments reflect our commitment to honor our obligations notwithstanding the extreme fiscal challenges we face in an effort to facilitate a voluntary restructuring process with our creditors,” says GDB PresidentÂ Melba Acosta Febo.
    • MBIÂ +6.3%, AGOÂ +2%, AMBC flat (was down earlier).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 43 Comments
  • ROAN

    Linn Energy price target lowered to $1.50 at FBR

    • Linn Energy (LINE -1.5%) is maintained with an Underperform rating and its stock price target is cut to $1.50 from $2 at FBR Capital, which says LINE's proved reserve value remains well below its debt.
    • FBR does not expect LINE to reinstate a distribution in the near term, and thus foresees minimal residual value for unitholders without a meaningful recovery in commodity prices.
    • LINE recently closed a series of note exchanges as it seeks to lower leverage and position for continued weak oil and gas prices, which FBR believes are steps in the right direction but still sees substantial macro headwinds for the company, which are likely to prevent additional material progress.
    • LNCO -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM | 20 Comments
  • WIN

    Windstream Holdings up 1.9% on pair of upgrades to Outperform

    • Windstream Holdings (NASDAQ:WIN) is up 1.9% after a pair of ratings bumps from analysts.
    • Raymond James upgraded the stock to Outperform from Market Perform. RBC Capital has made the same move, lifting its own rating to Outperform.
    • Ratings sentiment on Windstream is almost evenly split between Buy and Hold among analysts, though Jefferies Group had reiterated its Underperform rating in August (but bumped its price target up to $3.50).
    • Shares are trading at $6.35 and have gained 5.8% over the past five days.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 2 Comments
  • QTRH

    WiLAN strikes licensing deal with Crane; shares +5.4%

    • Industrial equipment maker Crane is licensing vending machine-related IP from WiLAN (WILN). The deal ends an infringement suit involving the companies. Terms are confidential.
    • The announcement shortly follows one about a deal with Taiwanese chip packaging/testing firm Powertech. Both deals cover patents acquired from Panasonic.
    • WiLAN is higher on modest volume (28K shares). Shares plunged a month ago after WiLAN missed Q3 revenue estimates (while slightly beating on EPS), announced a major dividend cut, and stated it's cutting ~30% of its workforce.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM | 3 Comments
  • LLIT

    Dehaier Medical up 52% on potential $20M stake by Chinese investor

    • Thinly traded nano cap Dehaier Medical Systems (DHRM +52.4%) jumps on 15x surge in volume, albeit on turnover of only 600K shares, in response to the company's disclosure that has received a non-binding indication (letter?) that Shenzhen Stock Exchange-listed Hangzhou Liaison Interactive Technology Co. proposes to make a $20M equity investment in the firm by buying 10M newly issued shares at $2 per share. The board of directors is currently evaluating the terms of the proposed investment.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • MONIF

    Monitise -7.1% as CFO becomes latest exec to depart

    • Struggling payments firm Monitise (OTC:MONIF) is off 7.1% in OTC trading after losing another key executive, with Chief Financial Officer Brad Petzer leaving his role.
    • Petzer is leaving the board immediately and will continue to serve as CFO until a replacement is found.
    • Monitise shares, deep into penny-stock territory for more than a year, have lost 90% of value YTD. The market cap of the company is now $92M.
    • Shares fell 6.7% in London on the news.
    • The company has struggled to maintain stable leadership, after founder and co-CEO Alastair Lukies exited in March and later, sole CEO Elizabeth Buse departed in September.
    • Previously: Deathwatch grows for Monitise after grim results (Sep. 11 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 3 Comments
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining downgraded at Citi amid lower gold prices

    • Newmont Mining (NEM -2.5%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a $20 price target, cut from $23, at Citigroup, as the firm reduces its 2016 forecast for gold (-10%) and copper (-12%) prices.
    • Citi lowers its NEM EPS estimates to reflect its reduced price forecasts, to $1.06 from $1.19 for 2015, to $0.15 from $0.66 for 2016, and to $0.27 from $1.01 for 2017.
    • Despite a $1,000/oz. gold price forecast for 2016, the firm believes NEM will still be able to generate free cash flow of $257M, with higher forecast gold prices driving further improvements in 2017 forward.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 5 Comments
  • RPRX

    Repros receives CRL from FDA regarding enclomiphene citrate NDA; shares slump 33%

    • The FDA issues a Complete Response Letter (CRL) to Repros Therapeutics (RPRX -33%) in response to its New Drug Application (NDA) seeking approval of enclomiphene citrate for the treatment of men with low testosterone due to secondary hypogonadism, a condition caused by insufficient stimulation of the testes by the pituitary gland.
    • In the letter, the agency states, based on scientific developments, that the design of the Phase 3 studies supporting the NDA is no longer adequate to show clinical benefit and the company will need to conduct an additional study to support approval in the target population. It also includes concerns about study entry criteria, titration and bioanalytical method validation in the Phase 3 program.
    • The company intends to work with the regulator to clarify a path forward that will address all its concerns. CEO Joe Podolski says, "We are disappointed that the FDA has taken this position without the benefit of an advisory committee recommendation. We plan to work closely with the agency to gain more information to determine the appropriate next steps regarding the enclomiphene application."
    • Shares are down on more than triple normal volume.
    • Previously: FDA action date approaches for Repros' Androxal (Nov. 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 1 Comment
  • LIVE

    Live Ventures -6.9%; planning sale of real estate

    • Live Ventures (NASDAQ:LIVE) is 6.9% lower after saying it will sell the seven real properties owned by its wholly owned subsidiary Marquis Industries.
    • The company is pursuing a sale-leaseback for the properties. "We believe that it is prudent for us to sell the real estate to unlock value," said CEO Jon Isaac.
    • Marcus & Millichap is listing the properties for an aggregate $13M, proceeds of which the company will apply toward retiring its high-interest debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • MRVL

    Marvell up 4.4% amid bullish Cowen note, Sony rumor

    • Cowen has hiked its Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) target by $0.50 to $12, while reiterating an Outperform. The vote of confidence comes as the chipmaker continues an accounting review that has weighed heavily on shares, and five weeks after auditor PwC resigned.
    • Also: A vague rumor has surfaced that Sony (not known for aggressive chip M&A activity) is looking to buy a stake in Marvell. Marvell supplies a networking ASIC and Wi-Fi controller IC for the PS4.
    • Marvell hasn't yet released FQ3 (October quarter) results. Last month, the company said it would release "preliminary" FQ3 numbers by early December.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM | 1 Comment
  • REXX

    Rex Energy downgraded to Sell at Stifel

    • Rex Energy (REXX -12.4%) is routed after Stifel downgrades shares to Sell from Hold with a $0.75 target price, even though the stock has been decimated over the past 12 months, as the firm says the financial risk does not warrant a Hold rating.
    • Although REXX exited the latest quarter with enough liquidity to fund a projected $74M outspend in 2016, Stifel believes the company will have "very little cushion" to cover interest expenses next year; based on updated estimates, the firm currently projects 2016 interest coverage of 1.2x.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 2 Comments
  • CBOE

    CBOE pulls back as Raymond James rings the register

    • CBOE Holdings (NASDAQ:CBOE) had been up nearly 30% since the beginning of May, but isÂ lower by 3.9%Â today as Raymond James pulls its Outperform rating after its $72 price target was hit.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • PKY

    Parkway Properties on the move after upgrade

    • Parkway Properties (PKY +2.2%) gets its 2nd upgrade in a week, with Stifel boosting to Buy from Hold. The $19.50 price target is 14% above last night's close.
    • Mizuho made a similar upgrade one week ago.
    • Parkway is off modestly year to date, but up nearly 15% since Labor Day.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • MFRM

    Mattress Firm wakes up after snapping up Sleepy's

    • Mattress Firm (NASDAQ:MFRM) is up 8% in early trading on heavy volume after the company announced it was acquiring the Sleepy's chain and released preliminary FQ3 numbers.
    • Previously: Preliminary FQ3 numbers from Mattress Firm top expectations (Nov. 30 2015)
    • Previously: Mattress firm acquires the Sleepy's chain (Nov. 30 2015)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 2 Comments
  • PERI

    Perion obtains $10M investment via JPMorgan; shares +9.1%

    • An advisory client of JPMorgan has invested $10M in Perion (NASDAQ:PERI). In addition, the company has obtained a $20M credit facility from Israel's Bank Leumi.
    • For reference, Perion currently has a $171M market cap (not counting the impact of the investment). The company ended Q3 with $129.4M in cash, and $38.2M in debt.
    • Shares have jumped a day after closing just $0.16 above a 52-week low of $2.05.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • RAX

    Rackspace +3%; RBC upgrades, cites strong enterprise cloud demand

    • Predicting the company will benefit from strong enterprise cloud infrastructure (IaaS) demand, RBC's Jonathan Atkin has upgraded Rackspace (NYSE:RAX) to Outperform. His target remains at $36.
    • Atkin: "In our view, part of the accelerated [enterprise cloud] demand will be in the managed cloud segment, where RAX stands to gain by virtue of its growing ability to provide support on [third-party] cloud platforms, as well as its own OpenStack-based platform.
    • He thinks revenue growth could accelerate in 2016, and that capex intensity could decline (boosting free cash flow). Atkin also believes Rackspace "could have strategic appeal as an acquisition target for companies wishing to expand their cloud, hosting, and IT product and market reach."
    • The upgrade comes three weeks after Rackspace jumped in the wake of a Q3 beat fueled in part by margin growth and large buybacks.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:12 AM | 3 Comments

  • Yields fall as ISM Manufacturing slips into contraction zone

    • November's 48.6 read puts the ISM index into contraction for the first time in three years. It's also the weakest print since July 2009.
    • Economists expected the gauge to rise to 50.5 from 50.1 in October, and strategists are scrambling to see if there's precedent for the Fed launching a rate hike cycle with the ISM below 50.
    • Turning to the subindexes ...
    • New Orders fell to 48.9 from 52.9, Production 49.2 from 52.9, Supplier Deliveries 50.6 from 50.4, Prices 35.5 from 39, Backlogs 43 from 42.5, Employment 51.3 from 47.6.
    • At 2.24% ahead of the number, the 10-year Treasury yield is now at 2.18%, off three basis points on the session. TLTÂ +0.6%, TBTÂ -1.2%
    • Full report
    • ETFs: TBT, TLT, TMV, TBF, EDV, TMF, TTT, ZROZ, TLH, SBND, VGLT, UBT, DLBS, TLO, TENZ, LBND, DLBL, TYBS, VUSTX
     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 26 Comments
  • NOK

    Nokia/Alcatel gain on Credit Suisse upgrades; Ericsson lower on downgrade

    • Credit Suisse's Kulbinder Garcha has upgraded Nokia (NOK +2.7%) and Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +2.4%) to Outperform ahead of the closing of their merger (set to occur in 1H16), and respectively hiked his targets to €9 ($9.54) and €4.95 ($5.25). Rival Ericsson (ERIC -1.7%) has been downgraded to Underperform, with its target cut to SKR75 ($8.65).
    • Garcha expects Nokia/Alcatel to achieve significantly greater cost synergies than what management has forecast, as Nokia applies its "operational discipline" to Alcatel businesses. €1.7B/year worth of synergies are deemed possible by 2018 (guidance is for €900M), with €1.1B obtained by eliminating duplicate mobile infrastructure operating expenses and €480M by moving work to lower-cost regions. Altogether, he thinks the combined company's op. income (EBIT) could nearly double by 2018 to €4.3B.
    • Regarding Ericsson, Garcha expects weak mobile infrastructure capex - he respectively forecasts 3% and 4% declines for 2016 and 2017 - to lead the company's revenue to drop 2% and 1% over the next two years. He also considers Street expectations for savings from cost-cutting efforts to be too high.
    • Separately, Nokia has launched OZO, its 360-degree virtual reality camera array for professionals. Ozo, which will compete against a GoPro (NASDAQ:GPRO) VR array, sports eight cameras that each record at a 2K x 2K resolution, along with eight microphones and 500GB of storage. It's expected to ship in Q1, and will sell for a steep $60K.
    • Last month: Ericsson slumps, takes Nokia/Alcatel with it after providing 2014-2018 growth outlook

  • SYN

    Synthetic Bio's SYN-004 successful in mid-stage study; shares up 5% premarket

    • Micro cap Synthetic Biologics (NYSEMKT:SYN) is upÂ 5%Â premarket on increased volume in response to its announcement of positive top-line results in a Phase 2a study assessing lead product candidate SYN-004's ability to protect the gut microbiome from the unwanted effects of certain commonly used intravenous beta-lactam antibiotics for the prevention of Clostridium difficile (C. diff) infection and antibiotic-related diarrhea. Data from 10 ileostomized (opening in the belly for waste removal) patients who completed the study showed that treatment with either of two doses of SYN-004 (75 mg and 150 mg) successfully degraded residual IV ceftriaxone in the chyme (digestive fluid in the small intestine) without affecting the level of ceftriaxone in the bloodstream.
    • Top-line results from a second Phase 2a, assessing SYN-004 in the presence of the proton pump inhibitor, esomeprazole, in patients with ileostomies are expected in H1 2016.
    • A Phase 2b study evaluating the effectiveness of SYN-004 in preventing C. diff infection and C. diff-associated diarrhea, in addition to antibiotic-associated diarrhea in up to 370 patients hospitalized for a lower respiratory tract infection and receiving IV ceftriaxone is underway.

  • Loonie weakens after Canada GDP report

    • Q3 GDP grew an inline 2.3%, but the monthly read for September showed a 0.5% contraction - the largest monthly decline since the height of the financial crisis. Economists had expected no change for September.
    • Among the possible reasons for the quick slowdown were a fire curbing oil production in Alberta, and the shutdown of a unit by Nexen Energy.
    • Up nicely on the session ahead of the print, the loonie is now modestly lower, buying $0.7479.
    • ETFs: FXC, EWC, CNDA, EWCS, QCAN, FCAN, HEWC

  • VSLR

    TerraForm up sharply on Tepper letter highlighting conflicts

    • "The July announcement of the acquisition of the Vivint Solar (NYSE:VSLR) portfolio of residential rooftop assets ... appears to serve the sole purpose of promoting SunEdison's (SUNE) desire to acquire VSLR's development and operating assets, rather than enhancing the quality and value of TERP's holdings," says David Tepper in a letter to the TerraForm (NASDAQ:TERP) board.
    • "Substantial further disclosures are incumbent on TERP so that investors can assess the full impact of the pending transactions, the relationship between TERP and its "Sponsor," and the circumstances surrounding the changes in TERP's management and board."

    Breitburn Energy suspends distribution of common units

    • Breitburn Energy Partners (BBEP) -19.5% premarket after saying it is suspending the monthly distribution of its common units, citing the ongoing weakness in crude oil prices.

  • ESRX

    Express Scripts and Imprimis Pharma team up offer $1 alternative to Daraprim; Imprimis up 21% premarket

    • Taking direct aim at Martin Shkreli's Turing Pharmaceuticals, Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX) and Imprimis Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IMMY-OLD) partner up to offer patients a low-cost alternative to Turing's $750-per-pill Daraprim (pyrimethamine).
    • Imprimis is offering a compounded oral formulation of pyrimethamine and leucovorin (a form of folic acid) for $1 per capsule for people whose pharmacy benefit is managed by Express Scripts. Prescriptions will be processed starting this week.
    • Mr. Shkreli earned pariah status in the pharmaceutical world with his aggressive price hike of Daraprim. He bought the rights to the 60-year old drug for $55M from Impax Laboratories (IPXL) and then immediately raised the price from ~$1 per pill to $750 per pill.
    • IMMY is upÂ 21%Â premarket on light volume.
    • Previously: Imprimis Pharma fills the Daraprim price void with low cost formulation; shares up 26% premarket (Oct. 23)
    • Previously: Turing's Shkreli bows to pressure and drops price of Daraprim (Sept. 23)
